intro: Chiococca grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered chiococca, is a climbing plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, pale yellow to white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understorey of dense tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
